title: Web-Based Science Learning Motivation Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Science fundamentals and job-related core concept understanding
context.additional_context: A science learning motivation enhancement program conducted in smartphone-centric limited technology environments. Learning outcomes measured through project-based assessments, emphasizing self-directed inquiry using web-based learning tools (Web-LE).

learning_goals: Learners enhance learning motivation by more than 20% through scientific inquiry activities in web-based learning environments

Over a two-week mid-term course, learners solve two challenging tasks weekly (e.g., algorithm optimization problems), engage in three or more curiosity-driven discussions (e.g., emerging technology trend analyses), and participate twice weekly in interactive peer learning activities (e.g., pair programming sessions), creating and executing self-directed learning plans.

Within four weeks, learners complete one software prototype applying scientific concepts (e.g., physics laws, data analysis) and earn an average creative problem-solving score of 4/5 or higher from a corporate practitioner evaluation panel.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
